ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot of useful grammar and vocabulary!

Gained a much greater control over Korean language, including speaking, writing, and listening. This course had a lot more practice with "daily life" conversations and introduced lots of cultural concepts.
Improved my Korean speaking and prose!

Learned more grammar structures, filled in gaps in understanding from previous semesters, learned personably applicable vocab (major, specific hobbies, etc), digressed a bit from curriculum at times to have a deeper understanding of where certain grammar rules come from (for example we spent a few days learning plain speech because it helps with learning indirect quotation).

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The teacher is very engaging and helpful! The content is very useful

Strengths: Back ssn. is an amazing professor and very kind and energetic. Even when everyone in the class is tired she manages to wake us up and get us to laugh. The course had a heavy emphasis on speaking practice and the daily pair conversations were very helpful in getting in more speaking. Back ssn. also carefully curates the assignments for this class so it was never overwhelming.

Weaknesses: While this can't be changed, it is a very fast paced course. In L1 and L2, you cover 9 units from the textbook. In L3, we covered 18! It felt very rushed at times, especially near the end. A bit more practice throughout the course on grammar points we learned earlier on would help in making sure we actually learned the content.
Great pace, organized class, expectations were clear

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would highly recommend this course to another student! L3 greatly improved my Korean abilities and I learned so much in a low-stress environment.
